subject: Parenting
title: Why Kids Ask Why
description: Learn Why Kids Ask Why in one minute.

hook.text: A four-year-old asks 'why' three hundred times a day. That number isn't exaggerated.

buildup.text: The 'why' phase starts around three and signals a hunger to understand cause and effect.

discovery.text: Each 'why' is the brain testing whether the world follows logical rules.

twist.text: Kids aren't trying to annoy you. They're building causal chains â€” if this, then what?

climax.text: Children whose questions get real answers develop stronger reasoning skills.

quiz.question: What cognitive skill are children practicing when they ask 'why' repeatedly?
